properties.title: The Ant Task for the Castor schema generator
properties.author: Werner Guttmann
properties.abstract: Describes how to use the Ant task for the Castor XML schema gnerator and what is currently supported.

body.title: Using the Ant task for the Castor XML schema generator

section.title: Castor XML schema generator Ant task
section.p: An alternative to using the command line as shown in the previous section, the Castor XML schema generator Ant task can be used to call the XML schema generator for XML schema generation. The only requirement is that the castor-<version>-anttasks.jar must be on the CLASSPATH.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Please find below the complete list of parameters that can be set on the Castor XML schema generator.

crow.td: The name of the XML file to use as input for XML schema generation.
The name of the XML schema file to be generated; if not specified, a suffix '.xsd' will be appended to the input file name.
To indicate that <xsd:all/> should be used as default grouping.

section.p: Alternatively to specifying the file property, it is possible to work with a nested <FileSet> element or with the dir property.

section.title: Example
section.p: Below is an example of how to use this task from within an Ant target definition named 'castor:schema:gen':
section.code-panel:
<target name="castor:schema:gen" depends="init" description="Generate an XML schema from an XML document instance.">
<taskdef name="schema-gen" classname="org.castor.anttask.XMLInstance2SchemaTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="generated" /> <schema-gen file="src/main/resources/input.xml" schemaFileName="target/generated/schema/input.xsd" /> </target>
